poem_title: THE Horse and the Olive: OR, WAR and PEACE.
author: Thomas Parnell

lines.line_text: WITH  Tale let Ancient  move,
Which thus I sing to make the  wise:
Strong  once with sage  strove,
And rising  was the  Prize.

stanzas.stanza_text:
WITH  Tale let Ancient  move,
Which thus I sing to make the  wise:
Strong  once with sage  strove,
And rising  was the  Prize.

lines.line_text: By  (Guardian Pow'r of Gain),
By Great  Bright  stood:
But  superior bad the Side obtain
Which best contriv'd to do the  Good.

stanzas.stanza_text:
By  (Guardian Pow'r of Gain),
By Great  Bright  stood:
But  superior bad the Side obtain
Which best contriv'd to do the  Good.

lines.line_text: Then  striking, from the parted Ground
The Warlike  came pawing on the Plain,
And as it toss'd its Mane, and pranc'd around,
By this, he cries, I'll make the  Reign.

stanzas.stanza_text:
Then  striking, from the parted Ground
The Warlike  came pawing on the Plain,
And as it toss'd its Mane, and pranc'd around,
By this, he cries, I'll make the  Reign.

lines.line_text: The  smiling gently bow'd the Spear,
And, rather thus they shall be bless'd, she said;
Then upwards shooting in the Vernal Air
With loaded Boughs the fruitful  spread.

stanzas.stanza_text:
The  smiling gently bow'd the Spear,
And, rather thus they shall be bless'd, she said;
Then upwards shooting in the Vernal Air
With loaded Boughs the fruitful  spread.

lines.line_text: saw what Gifts the  design'd,
And took th' impartial Scales, resolv'd to show,
If greater Bliss in  we find,
Or in the  which  bestow.

stanzas.stanza_text:
saw what Gifts the  design'd,
And took th' impartial Scales, resolv'd to show,
If greater Bliss in  we find,
Or in the  which  bestow.

lines.line_text: On  part he plac'd
Gay  won, and  extending wide:
But  and
Scale with greater weight supply'd.

stanzas.stanza_text:
On  part he plac'd
Gay  won, and  extending wide:
But  and
Scale with greater weight supply'd.

lines.line_text: Fierce  devours whom gentle  wou'd save,
Sweet  restores what angry  destroys,
made for  with that rewards the Brave,
While  its Pleasures from it self enjoys.

stanzas.stanza_text:
Fierce  devours whom gentle  wou'd save,
Sweet  restores what angry  destroys,
made for  with that rewards the Brave,
While  its Pleasures from it self enjoys.

lines.line_text: Hence vanquish'd  to the Sea withdrew,
Hence wise  rul'd  Lands,
Her  hence in Arts and Honour grew,
And still her  deck  Hands.

stanzas.stanza_text:
Hence vanquish'd  to the Sea withdrew,
Hence wise  rul'd  Lands,
Her  hence in Arts and Honour grew,
And still her  deck  Hands.

lines.line_text: From  thus disclos'd, a Monarch's Mind
May form just Rules to chuse the Truly-Great:
And  weary'd with Distresses find
Whose kind Endeavours most befriend the State.

stanzas.stanza_text:
From  thus disclos'd, a Monarch's Mind
May form just Rules to chuse the Truly-Great:
And  weary'd with Distresses find
Whose kind Endeavours most befriend the State.

lines.line_text: Ev'n  here may learn to place her Love,
If  won her  Wealth have cost,
If  Thoughts the PATRIOT-SOULS approve
Whose Cares restore that Wealth the Wars had lost.

stanzas.stanza_text:
Ev'n  here may learn to place her Love,
If  won her  Wealth have cost,
If  Thoughts the PATRIOT-SOULS approve
Whose Cares restore that Wealth the Wars had lost.

lines.line_text: But if we ask the  to disclose
Whom best EUROPA'S  it calls,
Great  Title no Exception knows,
And unapply'd in this the  falls.

stanzas.stanza_text:
But if we ask the  to disclose
Whom best EUROPA'S  it calls,
Great  Title no Exception knows,
And unapply'd in this the  falls.

lines.line_text: With Her no  or  vyes;
Whene'er she pleas'd her  to Conquest flew,
Whene'er she pleases  arise:
She gave the  and gives the  too.

stanzas.stanza_text:
With Her no  or  vyes;
Whene'er she pleas'd her  to Conquest flew,
Whene'er she pleases  arise:
She gave the  and gives the  too.
